main_definition: When two or more things are equal, they have the same value, quantity, size, or quality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having the same amount or number as something else.
meanings_and_examples.example: The teams had an equal number of players.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not having any difference in value, size, quantity, or importance between two things.
meanings_and_examples.example: They were equally matched in terms of skills and experience.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Acknowledging that everyone is treated the same way regardless of their gender, race, religion, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: The company promotes equal opportunities for all employees.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reflecting an unbiased or fair attitude when making decisions or judgments.
meanings_and_examples.example: He made his decision based on the merits of each candidate, treating them equally.
